node.title: 'We had just about given up hope': Ancient assassin spider survived Kangaroo Island bushfires
node.alt: Zephyrarchaea austini found during Landcare funded surveys
node.description: A pair of assassin spiders — a species feared extinct after the Kangaroo Island bushfires — have been found outside their known range on the island.
node.content:
["An ancient species of spider, feared extinct after\u00a0devastating bushfires\u00a0tore through Kangaroo Island in the summer of 2020, has been found alive.", "The assassin spider, also called\u00a0the pelican spider (Zephyrarchaea austini),\u00a0was only known to live in the Western River Regional Protection Area on\u00a0Kangaroo Island.", "That area was razed in the massive bushfire\u00a0that burnt through more than 200,000\u00a0hectares of bush and farmland across the island nearly 2 years ago.", "But two individuals \u2014 a female and a juvenile \u2014 have been\u00a0found in a small patch of leaf litter, according to Jessica Marsh, an honorary research associate at the South Australian Museum.", "While the researchers are keeping the exact location under wraps, it was outside the previous known range of the spider on Kangaroo Island, Dr Marsh said.", "\"These spiders don't disperse far, so it's very unlikely they've\u00a0moved there before the fires.\"", "", "
The Western River Wilderness Protection\u00a0Area, where the spiders were previously found, was hit hard by the bushfires.(Supplied: South Australian Museum)
", "The discovery was made at the end of September, but the announcement was delayed until DNA testing could confirm it was the same\u00a0species of assassin spider.", "The spider\u00a0dates back to the Jurassic period, and is called an assassin\u00a0for the\u00a0way it hunts other spiders.", "It's considered to play a crucial role as a regulator of spiders within the food web.", "Given that the spider has been found outside its known range, Dr Marsh said her team would keep expanding their search, which has been funded by the\u00a0Landcare Led Bushfire Recovery Grants Program.", "\"I'm not confident that we've got all of them,\" she said.", "She said the focus at this stage would be on locating and protecting any more populations if they find them, but that they may consider intervening to assist in recovery, such as through captive breeding, down the track.", "
Recovery, if it happens, will be slow
", "The discovery of a juvenile is a promising sign that breeding has happened since the bushfires.", "But recovery\u00a0of the species is still extremely tenuous.", "It's likely the population has gone through what is known as a genetic bottleneck.", "There will likely be far less genetic diversity between the remaining spiders\u00a0than in the previous population, meaning if a new population is able to establish, it could be less resilient to stressors.", "And there are other challenges to its recovery, Dr Marsh said.", "\"There are several things that aren't on their side.", "\"Low dispersal is a key one. And\u00a0the habitat\u00a0they live in,\u00a0it's going to take a long time for that habitat to regrow.\"", "The spiders are habitat specialists, living in dense vegetation along creek lines.", "Where they have been discovered is in some very small remaining pockets of that habitat, Dr Marsh said.", "\"It shows us how important those little\u00a0pockets are,\" she said.", "Only about a third of invertebrate species in Australia have been described by science, according to Dr Marsh.", "Many may be threatened or have already gone extinct without us identifying them or understanding their ecosystem functions.", "\"There is\u00a0a massive amount [of species] that are under\u00a0threat,\" she said.", "\"We're not talking about extinction in isolation. When it's more species and more land lost, we may start to notice.\""]
